S.FORM: pituay ku tuki aku tayza i cacudadan ayza a demiad.
pitoay ko toki ako tayza i cacodadan ayza a demiad.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: micudad tu, micumud tu ku saydan i cacudadan, sakamu sa ku mikeliday niyam," mutizeng! mibaung!"
micodad to, micomod to ko saydan i cacodadan, sakamo sa ko mikeliday niyam," motizeng! mibaong!"
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: tanutuwa han niyam musakamu," mahica tu saydan."
tanotowa han niyam mosakamo," mahica to saydan."
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: yu picudadan sa, pasubana' ku saydan tamiyanan tu aasipen a kamu nu Sakizaya.
yo picodadan sa, pasobana' ko saydan tamiyanan to aasipen a kamo no Sakizaya.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Sakizaya language of numbers.

S.FORM: kilulen niyam ku saydan miasip, mudadiw kami tu aasipen a dadiw.
kilolen niyam ko saydan miasip, modadiw kami to aasipen a dadiw.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: yadah tu ku katinengan aku tu kamu nu Sakizaya.
yadah to ko katinengan ako to kamo no Sakizaya.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Sakizaya languages.

S.FORM: dedemiad tayza kaku i cacudadan, dedemiad minanam kaku tu kamu nu Sakizaya, a musakamu kaku patengil ci inaan.
dedemiad tayza kako i cacodadan, dedemiad minanam kako to kamo no Sakizaya, a mosakamo kako patengil ci inaan.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Sakizaya language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ci Kacaw ku ngangan aku.
ci Kacaw ko ngangan ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是kacaw。
My name is kacaw.

S.FORM: ci Asing ku ngangan ni ama aku.
ci Asing ko ngangan ni ama ako.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Asing。
My dad's name is Asing.

S.FORM: ci Ipay ku ngangan ni ina aku.
ci Ipay ko ngangan ni ina ako.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Ipay。
My mother's name is Ipay.

S.FORM: cacay a bataan ku mihcaan aku ayza.
cacay a bataan ko mihcaan ako ayza.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: cacay ku kakama aku, ci Kulas ku ngangan, sabaw cacay ku mihcaan niza ayza.
cacay ko kakama ako, ci Kolas ko ngangan, sabaw cacay ko mihcaan niza ayza.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Kulas，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is kulas, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: malecaday ku cacudadan niyam micudad.
malecaday ko cacodadan niyam micodad.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: manamuh kaku aci kakama mudadiw.
manamoh kako aci kakama modadiw.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: manamuh kaku mingaduy, yu pihibangan sa, maladay amin kami u lalabu nu luma' tayza mingaduy.
manamoh kako mingadoy, yo pihibangan sa, maladay amin kami o lalabo no loma' tayza mingadoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: manamuh kaku tu baluhayay a cabay, ngay a maladay kami mudadiw atu mingaduy.
manamoh kako to balohayay a cabay, ngay a maladay kami modadiw ato mingadoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: u wawa nu Sakizaya kaku.
o wawa no Sakizaya kako.
S.TRANSL: 我是撒奇萊雅族的小孩。
I am an Sakizaya child.

S.FORM: i Takubuwan ku luma' niyam.
i Takobowan ko loma' niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在達固部灣。
Our family lives in Takubuwan.

S.FORM: lalima ku tademaw nu luma' niyam.
lalima ko tademaw no loma' niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tatulu ku calekakaan niyam.
tatolo ko calekakaan niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: mapulung kaku aci ama, ina, kakama, kakana mueneng.
mapolong kako aci ama, ina, kakama, kakana moeneng.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: talakaw ci ama aku, u kingcal ci ama aku.
talakaw ci ama ako, o kingcal ci ama ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: makudus ci ina aku, u misaydan ci ina aku.
makodos ci ina ako, o misaydan ci ina ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: i luma' hanu u kamu nu Sakizaya masasukamu ci ama i tamiyanan.
i loma' hano o kamo no Sakizaya masasokamo ci ama i tamiyanan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Sakizaya language with us at home.

S.FORM: yu pihibangan nu lalud taluma' namin kami i niyazu'.
yo pihibangan no lalod taloma' namin kami i niyazo'.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: maladay kaku aci kakama, kakana tayza mizakep tu balaut.
maladay kako aci kakama, kakana tayza mizakep to balaot.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: manamuh kaku tu lalabu nu luma' a tademaw niyam.
manamoh kako to lalabo no loma' a tademaw niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: maladay kaku aci ina midang ayza a demiad.
maladay kako aci ina midang ayza a demiad.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: langdaw ku tapuku nu demiad, caay ka sienaw caay ka caledes ku demiad, banihiw ku bali.
langdaw ko tapoko no demiad, caay ka sienaw caay ka caledes ko demiad, banihiw ko bali.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: i lutulutukan kami mukan tu pang, mapacilal ku uzip, sadihku sa.
i lotolotokan kami mokan to pang, mapacilal ko ozip, sadihko sa.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: kalahukan, masumad tu ku tapuku sumanah sa.
kalahokan, masomad to ko tapoko somanah sa.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: mipalita kaku ci inaan, kya sumanah ku tapuku.
mipalita kako ci inaan, kya somanah ko tapoko.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: sakamu sa ci ina, hakay a tayni ku baliyus.
sakamo sa ci ina, hakay a tayni ko baliyos.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: u labi nayay ku ladem i pabaw, tahekal tu ku bunac.
o labi nayay ko ladem i pabaw, tahekal to ko bonac.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: a taluma' tu kami.
a taloma' to kami.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: taluma'ay a zazan, miyukiw kaku tu bunac.
taloma'ay a zazan, miyokiw kako to bonac.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: adasay amana ka tayni ku baliyus, maydih henay kaku tahkal midang.
adasay amana ka tayni ko baliyos, maydih henay kako tahkal midang.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: i tepal nu luma' niyam ku cacudadan, muculil kaku tu dedemiad tacacudadan, muculil aca taluma'.
i tepal no loma' niyam ko cacodadan, mocolil kako to dedemiad tacacodadan, mocolil aca taloma'.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: caay ka tabaki ku cacudadan niyam, caay ka katuud ku micudaday, masasutineng amin.
caay ka tabaki ko cacodadan niyam, caay ka katood ko micodaday, masasotineng amin.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: masaupu amin iputah ku adiwawa, maladay mimali, pakungku.
masaopo amin ipotah ko adiwawa, maladay mimali, pakongko.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: maladay amin kami atu saydan misalama, mahiza u labuay nu luma' ku cacudadan.
maladay amin kami ato saydan misalama, mahiza o laboay no loma' ko cacodadan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: dedemiad miasik kami, a misadimel miasik tu picudadan.
dedemiad miasik kami, a misadimel miasik to picodadan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: u zuma a tademaw misipu tu sasingalan, u zuma sa miasik.
o zoma a tademaw misipo to sasingalan, o zoma sa miasik.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: miasik aca kami tu liwliw nu cacudadan, mawawada' tu kawaw, maaedap kami, tamelac sa tu ku cacudadan tu dedemiad.
miasik aca kami to liwliw no cacodadan, mawawada' to kawaw, maaedap kami, tamelac sa to ko cacodadan to dedemiad.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: nacila, tayza i niyazu' kaku mizizaw ci bakian.
nacila, tayza i niyazo' kako mizizaw ci bakian.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: matenes tu kami caay kasasukazih, mabulah kaku cinizaan.
matenes to kami caay kasasokazih, mabolah kako cinizaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: yu makaazih ci baki takuwan pakan takuwan tu ciyak, atu uciya.
yo makaazih ci baki takowan pakan takowan to ciyak, ato ociya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: sicedam ku nipalumaan nibaki a ciyak, tatenga' asu'.
sicedam ko nipalomaan nibaki a ciyak, tatenga' aso'.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: manamuh aca kaku tu uciya nibaki, asu' nanuman.
manamoh aca kako to ociya nibaki, aso' nanoman.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: i kalahukan, maladay kaku aci bai misakalahuk.
i kalahokan, maladay kako aci bai misakalahok.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: sakaasu'an sa ku pisakalahuk ni bai, izaw ku buting, tulakuk, tamulak, atu katacumuli.
sakaaso'an sa ko pisakalahok ni bai, izaw ko boting, tolakok, tamolak, ato katacomoli.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: mamin malahuk, tayza i bawbi kami milami'.
mamin malahok, tayza i bawbi kami milami'.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: yadah ku nipiala ni bai tu tubah, tali, atu dukiyu sapabeli takuwan sakataluma' aku.
yadah ko nipiala ni bai to tobah, tali, ato dokiyo sapabeli takowan sakataloma' ako.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: mikukay kaku tu henian, anu ayaw tayni aca kaku mizizaw tu henian.
mikokay kako to henian, ano ayaw tayni aca kako mizizaw to henian.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: ayza a demiad a ladayen kami nu saydan tayza i paaadupan, masasilsil kami i panan micakay tu paya.
ayza a demiad a ladayen kami no saydan tayza i paaadopan, masasilsil kami i panan micakay to paya.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: cumud sa kami i paaadupan, sakamu sa ku saydan, "nu ayawan u ayamay, nu zikuzan u bauay, nanuuzip han namu miazih."
comod sa kami i paaadopan, sakamo sa ko saydan, "no ayawan o ayamay, no zikozan o baoay, nanoozip han namo miazih."
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: matalaw kaku tu bau, kyu caay kaku piazih tu bauay.
matalaw kako to bao, kyo caay kako piazih to baoay.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: yadah ku maazihay aku a ayam, bahebahel sa kuheni i kilakilangan, maazih aca ku deku mudeku i buhang nu kilang a dibu.
yadah ko maazihay ako a ayam, bahebahel sa koheni i kilakilangan, maazih aca ko deko modeko i bohang no kilang a dibo.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: i paaadupan izaw ku zu, subayu atu tula', inaayaw caay henay kaku pakaazih tu aadupan, ayza a demiad manamuh kaku makaazih.
i paaadopan izaw ko zo, sobayo ato tola', inaayaw caay henay kako pakaazih to aadopan, ayza a demiad manamoh kako makaazih.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: yadah ku nisasingan aku, sapaazih aku ci amaan inaan.
yadah ko nisasingan ako, sapaazih ako ci amaan inaan.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: anuayaw a maladay aci ama ina tayni.
anoayaw a maladay aci ama ina tayni.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: pihibangan a lipay, tayza i Pusung kaku aci kakana mizizaw ci bakian.
pihibangan a lipay, tayza i Posong kako aci kakana mizizaw ci bakian.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: namakay Taypak kami mikacaw tu silamalay tayza i Pusung.
namakay Taypak kami mikacaw to silamalay tayza i Posong.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: katukuh tu i Pusung, makakazizeng ci baki tayni i pangizuan milikeluh tamian.
katokoh to i Posong, makakazizeng ci baki tayni i pangizoan milikeloh tamian.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: caay kabaat ku luma' nibaki tu pangizuan, makakazizeng kasenung sa katukuh tu.
caay kabaat ko loma' nibaki to pangizoan, makakazizeng kasenong sa katokoh to.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: i capi nu luma' ni baki izaw ku tabakiay a papahutingan, maladay kami makabatikal tayza i papahutingan.
i capi no loma' ni baki izaw ko tabakiay a papahotingan, maladay kami makabatikal tayza i papahotingan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: i papahutingan, ladayen ni baki kami pakan tu sizi atu mikacaw tu subayu.
i papahotingan, ladayen ni baki kami pakan to sizi ato mikacaw to sobayo.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: sansandeb, maladay kami tayza i nabakuwan malabi'.
sansandeb, maladay kami tayza i nabakowan malabi'.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: yadah ku kazizng i nabakuwan, kyu makautubay kami tayza.
yadah ko kazizng i nabakowan, kyo makaotobay kami tayza.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: yu a miliyas tu kami sa, maazih makidem ku utubay, kacaw satu kami tu basu miliyas.
yo a miliyas to kami sa, maazih makidem ko otobay, kacaw sato kami to baso miliyas.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: ayza katukuh tu kami i Taypak, mahicaay tu hakya ku utubay ni baki matepaay tu hakya.
ayza katokoh to kami i Taypak, mahicaay to hakya ko otobay ni baki matepaay to hakya.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: yu adidi' henay i Takubuwan ku luma' niyam, namicudad satu, malimad tayza i Taypak, hiza satu i tiza mauzip.
yo adidi' henay i Takobowan ko loma' niyam, namicodad sato, malimad tayza i Taypak, hiza sato i tiza maozip.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在達固部灣，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Takubuwan. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: yu micudad satu i tabakiay a cacudadan, mitucek kaku micudad tu nu Yuancumin lalangawan a cudad, makatineng tu Taywan Yuancumincu izaw ku canacanan yadahayay a lalangawan.
yo micodad sato i tabakiay a cacodadan, mitocek kako micodad to no Yoancomin lalangawan a codad, makatineng to Taywan Yoancominco izaw ko canacanan yadahayay a lalangawan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: sisa, ayza a mihcaan i pipahanhanan nu lalud, taluma' i niyazu' kaku aci kakama mizizaw tu babalaki, maydih a makatineng tu nuuzipay a binacadan a lalangawan.
sisa, ayza a mihcaan i pipahanhanan no lalod, taloma' i niyazo' kako aci kakama mizizaw to babalaki, maydih a makatineng to noozipay a binacadan a lalangawan.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: waluay a bataan tu ku mihcaan niza babalaki, nika azihen mahiza henay u masakapahay.
waloay a bataan to ko mihcaan niza babalaki, nika azihen mahiza henay o masakapahay.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: palitaan aku ciniza i cucuwaan ku katinengan niza a kamu, matinengay ciniza musakamu tu kamu nu Sakizaya, matineng musakamu aca tu kamu nu Pangcah, Ngayngay atu Lipun.
palitaan ako ciniza i cocowaan ko katinengan niza a kamo, matinengay ciniza mosakamo to kamo no Sakizaya, matineng mosakamo aca to kamo no Pangcah, Ngayngay ato Lipon.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的撒奇萊雅語說得很流利，也會說阿美族語，客家話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Sakizaya, as well as Pangcah, Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: palitaan aku ciniza kya matineng, alaw han yu adidi' henay ciniza minanam tu tu kamu nu Sakizaya, acawa niza sa u Pangcah, i kakulian niza katuud ku katinengan tu Ngayngay a tademaw, kyu matineng ciniza musakamu tu cacanan a kamu.

palitaan ako ciniza kya matineng, alaw han yo adidi' henay ciniza minanam to to kamo no Sakizaya, acawa niza sa o Pangcah, i kakolian niza katood ko katinengan to Ngayngay a tademaw, kyo matineng ciniza mosakamo to cacanan a kamo.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學撒奇萊雅語，太太是阿美族，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Pangcah, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: yu pizizawan niyam sa, yadah ku nisakamuan nu babalaki tu sakay piadupay a laylay a tineng.
yo pizizawan niyam sa, yadah ko nisakamoan no babalaki to sakay piadopay a laylay a tineng.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: kanahatu caay katalesem kami a mitengil, nika hanu limalay niyam a miluing, kya a satesek han tu a mitengil.
kanahato caay katalesem kami a mitengil, nika hano limalay niyam a miloing, kya a satesek han to a mitengil.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: yu adidi' henay kaku caay ka tinetineng tu nu uzipay a binacadan a lalangawan, alaw han u Yuancumin ku uzip masikaz tu.
yo adidi' henay kako caay ka tinetineng to no ozipay a binacadan a lalangawan, alaw han o Yoancomin ko ozip masikaz to.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: yu yadah tu ku katinengan satu sa, manamuh ka u Sakizaya a tademaw, u masazumaay, u kasasenengan aca.
yo yadah to ko katinengan sato sa, manamoh ka o Sakizaya a tademaw, o masazomaay, o kasasenengan aca.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為撒奇萊雅族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Sakizaya is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: ayza a sansandeb, a taluma' tu ci sabama.
ayza a sansandeb, a taloma' to ci sabama.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: tayza i iciba kaku aci bayi micakay tu tulakuk sapatata' tu asu'ay sakalabi ni sabama.
tayza i iciba kako aci bayi micakay to tolakok sapatata' to aso'ay sakalabi ni sabama.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: micaliway kami i pacakayay tu lami', yadah ku mangaduay a lami'.
micaliway kami i pacakayay to lami', yadah ko mangadoay a lami'.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: micakay kami tu ingcay, kuletu, ninzin.
micakay kami to ingcay, koleto, ninzin.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: i tepalay pacakayay tu heci a tawki sakamu sa," sicedam ku padingad atu lupas aku, picakay tu adidi' saw!"
i tepalay pacakayay to heci a tawki sakamo sa," sicedam ko padingad ato lopas ako, picakay to adidi' saw!"
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: micakay kami tu padingad atu lupas.
micakay kami to padingad ato lopas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: micaliway kami tu pacakayay tu titi, sakamu sa kya tawki, "u canan ku kaydihan namu saw? ayzaay a tulakuk tabaki kizemu, cacay ku tulakuk tulu a lasubu."
micaliway kami to pacakayay to titi, sakamo sa kya tawki, "o canan ko kaydihan namo saw? ayzaay a tolakok tabaki kizemo, cacay ko tolakok tolo a lasobo."
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: tada tekes sa ci bayi, mipalita tu tawki kapah ahemi'en tu adidi' haw sa.
tada tekes sa ci bayi, mipalita to tawki kapah ahemi'en to adidi' haw sa.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: nika sakamu sa kiza tawki ahemi'ay tu ku aca, laecus tu a miselep.
nika sakamo sa kiza tawki ahemi'ay to ko aca, laecos to a miselep.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: i tepalay a tawki sakamu sa katayni micakay tu buting aku, tabaki aca ahemi' aca ku buting aku.
i tepalay a tawki sakamo sa katayni micakay to boting ako, tabaki aca ahemi' aca ko boting ako.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: sazikuzay micakay kami tu tulakuk micakay aca tu buting, taluma' sa cacay a takal ku nisalami'.
sazikozay micakay kami to tolakok micakay aca to boting, taloma' sa cacay a takal ko nisalami'.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: matenes tu a muhalhal, duut tu ku demiad.
matenes to a mohalhal, doot to ko demiad.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: pakatelay ci sabama sakamu sa, caay aca pahanhan sa ku hitay, anu ayaw tu a lipay kya taluma'.
pakatelay ci sabama sakamo sa, caay aca pahanhan sa ko hitay, ano ayaw to a lipay kya taloma'.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: sakamu satu ci bayi yadah tu ku nisalami'an, awawen ku katuuday tayni mukan!
sakamo sato ci bayi yadah to ko nisalami'an, awawen ko katooday tayni mokan!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: awawen niyam ku laluma'an atu cabay, mapulung mukan tu yadahay a sakalabi.
awawen niyam ko laloma'an ato cabay, mapolong mokan to yadahay a sakalabi.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: izaw ku cacay a kaput aku ci Palihu, hina makatawal ciniza tu cacanan.
izaw ko cacay a kapot ako ci Paliho, hina makatawal ciniza to cacanan.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Palihu，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Palihu, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: yu a micudad tu sa, micaliw tu ciniza tu sapisulit, sasipu, atu sasulitan.
yo a micodad to sa, micaliw to ciniza to sapisolit, sasipo, ato sasolitan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: kinacacay, kinatusa, kinatulu, pacaliwen henay nu katuuday ciniza tu cacanan.
kinacacay, kinatosa, kinatolo, pacaliwen henay no katooday ciniza to cacanan.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: nika laecus ku mahiniay a wayway niza, hina caliw tu cacanan caay pacubelis.
nika laecos ko mahiniay a wayway niza, hina caliw to cacanan caay pacobelis.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: sazikuzay caay tu pacaliwen nu katuuday tu cacanan i cinizaan.
sazikozay caay to pacaliwen no katooday to cacanan i cinizaan.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: u cacay a demiad, maladay amin kami tahekal midang.
o cacay a demiad, maladay amin kami tahekal midang.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: teban nu zazan, akenih ci Palihu a mutayi', makatawal muala tu sapisingat ciniza.
teban no zazan, akenih ci Paliho a motayi', makatawal moala to sapisingat ciniza.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Palihu想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Palihu wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: a micaliw ciniza i kaput tu sapisingat, nika patubelien amin nu kaput inayay ku niala aku sa.
a micaliw ciniza i kapot to sapisingat, nika patobelien amin no kapot inayay ko niala ako sa.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: akenih tu ci Palihu muangic tu. mabalucu' ciniza sakamusa, kya caay amin kamu pacaliw tu sapisingat i takuwan!
akenih to ci Paliho moangic to. mabaloco' ciniza sakamosa, kya caay amin kamo pacaliw to sapisingat i takowan!
S.TRANSL: Palihu急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Palihu burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: sakamu han tu nu kaput, zayhan caay pikelid kisu tu cacanan numisu, saaca nipacaliwan niyam tisuan a cacanan, caay aca kisu pacubelis!
sakamo han to no kapot, zayhan caay pikelid kiso to cacanan nomiso, saaca nipacaliwan niyam tisoan a cacanan, caay aca kiso pacobelis!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: tucila micudad, matabal ci Palihu katukuh tu i cacudadan, pacubelisen amin ni Palihu ku nicaliwan tu cacanan i kaput.
tocila micodad, matabal ci Paliho katokoh to i cacodadan, pacobelisen amin ni Paliho ko nicaliwan to cacanan i kapot.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Palihu很早就到學校了，Palihu把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Palihu arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: papisulul ci Palihu tu kaput, sakamu sa anuayaw aku tu ku mukeliday tu cacanan, kukay tu kaput nuayawan pacaliw kamu i takuwan tu cacanan.
papisolol ci Paliho to kapot, sakamo sa anoayaw ako to ko mokeliday to cacanan, kokay to kapot noayawan pacaliw kamo i takowan to cacanan.
S.TRANSL: Palihu向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Palihu apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: u miadupay nu niyazu' ci ama aku.
o miadopay no niyazo' ci ama ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: yu adidi' henay kaku, tahekal ci ama aci sinaama i labi, mukelid tu sapiadup a bakan atu kuwang.
yo adidi' henay kako, tahekal ci ama aci sinaama i labi, mokelid to sapiadop a bakan ato kowang.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: takelal tu sa, miawit tu nikaala a niadupan taluma' kuheni.
takelal to sa, miawit to nikaala a niadopan taloma' koheni.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: alahican u kiwmah, alahicaan u lawal, alahican makaala tu tulakuk.
alahican o kiwmah, alahicaan o lawal, alahican makaala to tolakok.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: i sacumudan nu niyazu' silsilen tu nuheni ku nikaala a niadupan, sapawada' tu binawlan.
i sacomodan no niyazo' silsilen to noheni ko nikaala a niadopan, sapawada' to binawlan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: sawsawni milimula' kaku ci amaan, maydih a mikilul ci amaan miadup.
sawsawni milimola' kako ci amaan, maydih a mikilol ci amaan miadop.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: sakamu sa ci ama anubalaki tu kaku a ladayen aku kisu miadup.
sakamo sa ci ama anobalaki to kako a ladayen ako kiso miadop.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: u niyazu'ay a tatama matineng kuheni u bihekac ku sapiadup, misanga' aca kuheni tu bantek atu u baetu ku sapenec tu bihkac.
o niyazo'ay a tatama matineng koheni o bihekac ko sapiadop, misanga' aca koheni to bantek ato o baeto ko sapenec to bihkac.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: matinengay ci ama aku misanga' tu bantek, sakamu sa ci ama, sapibihkac tu tulakuk kuyni, sameteken miazih ku nazipaan nu aadupen, pazengen ku bihkac i niculilan nu aadupen.
matinengay ci ama ako misanga' to bantek, sakamo sa ci ama, sapibihkac to tolakok koyni, sameteken miazih ko nazipaan no aadopen, pazengen ko bihkac i nicolilan no aadopen.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: maydih kaku kalamkam a balaki maladay tu babalaki miadup, dedemiad minanam kaku misanga' tu bihekac, kalamkam satu nisanga'an aku a bihekac makaala tu tu aadupan.
maydih kako kalamkam a balaki maladay to babalaki miadop, dedemiad minanam kako misanga' to bihekac, kalamkam sato nisanga'an ako a bihekac makaala to to aadopan.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: namakaazih ci ama sakamu sa anuayaw u matinengay a miadupay kisu sa.
namakaazih ci ama sakamo sa anoayaw o matinengay a miadopay kiso sa.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: balaki tu kaku ayza, kunuyen aku ku sapiadup a pana' atu betil, mikilul ci amaan miadup.
balaki to kako ayza, konoyen ako ko sapiadop a pana' ato betil, mikilol ci amaan miadop.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: taluma' tu i niyazu' sa ya nikaala a niadupan pawada'en tu niyazu'ay a binawlan.
taloma' to i niyazo' sa ya nikaala a niadopan pawada'en to niyazo'ay a binawlan.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: sakamu sa ci ama, a mikukay kita tu Dietu tu pipakalemed ititaan, kyu yadah ku nikaala numita tu niadupan.
sakamo sa ci ama, a mikokay kita to Dieto to pipakalemed ititaan, kyo yadah ko nikaala nomita to niadopan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: mautang tu kaku tacudadan tu sananal.
maotang to kako tacodadan to sananal.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: tayza i cacudada hawsa, makatawal aku mikelid ku kabung.
tayza i cacodada hawsa, makatawal ako mikelid ko kabong.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: nayi' ku nikelid aku tu canan a tuudan.
nayi' ko nikelid ako to canan a toodan.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: micudad hawsa, mapulung miazih tu cudad kaku atu kaput.
micodad hawsa, mapolong miazih to codad kako ato kapot.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: miseking hawsa, pacaliwen nu kaput kaku tu sapisulit atu sabulic.
miseking hawsa, pacaliwen no kapot kako to sapisolit ato sabolic.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
